MTI.name: Message Type Indicator
MTI.notes: Indicates the type of message being sent. Examples: 0100 - Auth Request, 0200 - Financial Transaction Request, 0420 - Reversal Request.

PrimaryBitmap.name: Primary Bitmap
PrimaryBitmap.notes: Each bit corresponds to a specific data element (1-64). If a bit is set to 1, the corresponding data element must be present. Presence of Secondary Bitmap is indicated by the first bit.

SecondaryBitmap.name: Secondary Bitmap
SecondaryBitmap.notes: Used if data elements 65-128 are present. The primary bitmap's first bit must be set to 1 if this is included.

2.name: Primary Account Number (PAN)
2.notes: Should be validated using Luhn's check (mod 10). Must be encrypted and tokenized if present. Required for manually entered PANs or when track data is not available.

3.name: Processing Code
3.notes: Defines transaction type and account information. Example: 000000 - Debit, 200000 - Credit (refund). First 2 digits indicate transaction type, next 2 indicate from account, and last 2 indicate to account.

4.name: Amount, Transaction
4.notes: Represents the transaction amount in fixed length, padded with zeros. Last 2 digits represent decimal places.

5.name: Amount, Settlement
5.notes: Required if the transaction and settlement currencies are different. Not applicable for domestic transactions.

6.name: Amount, Cardholder Billing
6.notes: Required if the cardholder and settlement currencies are different. Includes fees from MasterCard.

7.name: Transmission Date and Time
7.notes: Format: MMDDhhmmss. Must be a valid date and time expressed in GMT.

8.name: Amount, Cardholder Billing Fee
8.notes: Required only if requested by the issuer. Not expected for domestic transactions.

9.name: Conversion Rate, Settlement
9.notes: Required if the transaction and settlement currencies are different. Not applicable for domestic transactions.

10.name: Conversion Rate, Cardholder Billing
10.notes: Required if the cardholder and settlement currencies are different. Not applicable for domestic transactions.

11.name: System Trace Audit Number
11.notes: Generated by the acquirer/merchant and ensures uniqueness for the day. Combined with other identifiers for global uniqueness.

12.name: Time, Local Transaction
12.notes: Format: hhmmss. Must be a valid time. Checked against issuer's system time for variance.

13.name: Date, Local Transaction
13.notes: Format: MMDD. Must be a valid date. Checked against issuer's system time for variance.

14.name: Date, Expiration
14.notes: Format: YYMM. Used along with DE 2 to validate the card.

15.name: Date, Settlement
15.notes: Format: MMDD. Must be a valid date. Checked against issuer's system time for variance.

17.name: Date, Capture
17.notes: Required if requested by the issuer. Format: MMDD.

18.name: Merchant Type
18.notes: Validates against a list of accepted Merchant Category Codes (MCCs).

19.name: Acquiring Institution Country Code
19.notes: Only received if acquirer and issuer are in different countries. Decline if received other than USA.

20.name: Primary Account Number (PAN) Extended Country Code
20.notes: Required if DE 34 (PAN Extended) is sent. Not applicable for MVP.

21.name: Forwarding Institution Country Code
21.notes: Only received if acquirer and issuer are in different countries. Decline if received other than USA.

22.name: Point-of-Service Entry Mode
22.notes: Indicates how card data was captured. Examples: 01X - Manual entry, 02X - Card swipe, 06X - Card swipe with PIN, 09X - eCommerce.

23.name: Card Sequence Number
23.notes: Sent only if track data is not sent for POS transactions and one PAN has multiple cards.

25.name: Point-of-Service Condition Code
25.notes: No specific validation required. Optional field.

26.name: Point-of-Service PIN Capture Code
26.notes: Indicates the PIN block. Ignored in production unless certification requires it.

27.name: Authorization Identification Response Length
27.notes: Used by acquirers that cannot accept 6-byte values in DE 38. Ignored if present.

28.name: Amount, Transaction Fee
28.notes: Required when DE 30 is present. Indicates surcharge, rebate, or transaction fee.

29.name: Amount, Settlement Fee
29.notes: Required if the transaction and settlement currencies are different. Not applicable for domestic transactions.

30.name: Amount, Transaction Processing Fee
30.notes: Required if requested by the issuer. No specific validation required.

31.name: Amount, Settlement Processing Fee
31.notes: Required if requested by the issuer. No specific validation required.

32.name: Acquiring Institution Identification Code
32.notes: Critical for MID adjudication. Format: 1NNNNNNNNC or 59NNNNNNNNC. Check digit must be validated.

33.name: Forwarding Institution Identification Code
33.notes: Optional field. No specific validation required.

34.name: Primay Account Number (PAN) Extended
34.notes: Optional field. No specific validation required.

35.name: Track 2 Data
35.notes: Required if DE 22 value is 02 or 06. Not applicable for manual entry transactions.

37.name: Retrieval Reference Number
37.notes: Generated by the acquirer and ensures uniqueness for the day. Combined with other identifiers for global uniqueness.

38.name: Authorization Identification Response
38.notes: Populated by the issuer. May be pre-populated in advice messages.

39.name: Response Code
39.notes: Indicates the result of the transaction. Example: '00' - Approved, '05' - Declined.

40.name: Service Restriction Code
40.notes: Optional field. No specific validation required.

41.name: Card Acceptor Terminal Identification
41.notes: Used for fraud analysis and MID verification.

42.name: Card Acceptor Identification Code
42.notes: Critical for MID-based adjudication. Default to MCC if not present for non-integrated merchants.

45.name: Track 1 Data
45.notes: Not expected for MVP. Ignore if received.

46.name: Additional Fees
46.notes: Not expected for MVP. Pass to auth engine if received.

47.name: Additional Data National
47.notes: Mainly used for 3DS authentication values. Ignore for MVP unless 3DS is supported.

48.name: Institution/Merchant Name/Consumer Name
48.notes: Ignore if received as it contains unreliable consumer data.

49.name: Currency Code, Transaction
49.notes: Must be USD for domestic transactions. Decline if any other currency code is received.

50.name: Currency Code, Settlement
50.notes: Not applicable for domestic transactions. Decline if received.

51.name: Currency Code, Cardholder Billing
51.notes: Not applicable for domestic transactions. Decline if received.

52.name: Personal Identification Number (PIN) Data
52.notes: Ignored in production unless certification requires it. Send to C-Box for validation during certification.

54.name: Additional Amounts
54.notes: Used for healthcare transactions. Pass to auth engine if received.

55.name: Integrated Chip Card (ICC) Data
55.notes: Decline with error code 12 if received, as EMV transactions are not supported in MVP.

57.name: Authorization Life Cycle
57.notes: Critical for fraud analysis. Values: 200 - Previous Auth Completion, 600 - PreAuth completion.

58.name: National Point-of-Service Condition Code
58.notes: Provides details about transaction conditions. Subfields include Terminal Class, Presentation Type, Security Condition, etc.

59.name: National Point-of-Service Geographical Data
59.notes: Includes State/Region Code, County Code, Postal Service Code, and Country Code. Configurable to be passed.

60.name: Advice/Reversal Reason Code
60.notes: Identifies the reason for reversal or advice. Byte map values: 80 - Reversal, 40 - Advice, C0 - Reversal of Advice.

61.name: Acquirer Transport Data
61.notes: Echoed to the acquirer in the response. Not passed to the issuer.

63.name: Mastercard Networks Exchange Data
63.notes: Used for least cost routing. Ignore for MVP.

63.1.name: Pseudo-Terminal
63.1.notes: Required if multiple pseudo terminals are needed.

63.3.name: Acquirer Network ID
63.3.notes: Sent if the issuer wants to know which network acquired the transaction.

63.4.name: Processor ID
63.4.notes: Sent if the issuer wants to know which processor acquired the transaction.

63.7.name: Processing Flags
63.7.notes: Sent if the issuer wants to know which processor acquired the transaction.

67.name: Extended Payment Code
67.notes: Sent if the issuer wants to know which processor acquired the transaction.

90.name: Original Data Elements
90.notes: Required on inbound messages to Mastercard Networks Exchange. The remaining subelements may be zero-filled. Outbound from Mastercard Networks Exchange, the original message type is sent. Original system trace audit number and local date and time are sent if available.

95.name: Replacement Amounts
95.notes: Required from acquirers, or sent to issuers, for ATM partial dispenses and for transactions where the amount that was successful is different from the authorized amount.

96.name: Message Security Code
96.notes: Processor-assigned password. Required when DE 70 (Network Management Information Code) contains specific values.

98.name: Payee
98.notes: Sent if available and if the transaction is a payment transaction.

100.name: Receiving Institution Identification Code
100.notes: Sent if routing is based on this DE instead of the PAN.

113.name: Authorizing Agent Institution ID Code (ANSI-defined)
113.notes: Required only if requested by the issuer.

120.name: Account Qualifiers
120.notes: Required only if requested by the issuer.

122.name: Sponsor Bank ID
122.notes: Required only if requested by the issuer.

123.name: Additional Data
123.notes: Required to support the Address Verification Service (AVS) and other types of verification data.

124.name: Tag Data Acquirer
124.notes: Sent if tagged data is available in tag-length-value (TLV) format.

125.name: Tag Data, Issuer
125.notes: Sent if tagged data is available in tag-length-value (TLV) format.

126.name: Issuer Trace Data
126.notes: Optional for Mastercard Networks Exchange ISO acquirers.

127.name: Acquirer Trace Data
127.notes: Optional for Mastercard Networks Exchange ISO acquirers. Not passed by default to ISO issuers but can be configured.

128.name: Message Authenticate Code
128.notes: Required when MACing messages, at least one DE between 65-127 is present, and no DEs between 129-191 are present.
